result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Bula was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time (including treatment sessions).

Community service 973.03(3).
Consecutive to: Jail sentence in count 1.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant  must continue with current treatment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Defendant  is allowed computer/Internet use for business purposes only and agrees to random searches of electronics if deemed necessary by DOC.

timeConds.notes: Must be completed within the first 2 years of probation.

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions the same as count 2 with no additional jail or community service.
Concurrent with: Count 2 but consecutive to jail time in count 1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Bula

records.addlTxt: from P&P agenct to court re: amending JOC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for furlough - per phone call Judge Stenz approved pursuant to Sheriff's policy

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: amended information - only amended date of offense on counts 1, 2 & 3.

Defendant Justin Bula in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:44 AM. Court has been handed PLQ. State - recites agreement, has filed amended INFO, plea of G 1, 2 & 3 and state would move to DRI remaining counts. Joint agreement of no prision sentence, with held sentence on 2 & 3, 10 years probation (free to argue length of probation), ct. 1 one year of straight jail time, ct. 2 - 1 year conditional jail, (free to argue consecutive/concurrent) with huber and asks to report to jail in December. Schultz indicates why he needs time to report, agreement also indicates no fine, $500 surcharge for each image plus court costs, sex offender registration to commence for 15 years after completion of probation/sentence. Schultz has amended INFO and he and defendant agree with recommendation.  Defendant pleads to Count 1 - Guilty, Count 2 - guilty, Count 3 - guilty. Court dismisses but reads in counts 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 & 10. Court goes over plea questionaire and finds defendant is freely and voluntarily entering his plea, finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges guilty. Court questions amended information. State stipulates that recommended sentence is in the best interest of the community of no prision time. Discussion on statue 973.048 regarding sex offender registration. State also stipulated no prosecution on material found from December's search warrant. State makes final statement, asks that counts 2 & 3 - 10 year probation be consecutive to jail time in count 1, conditional jail time in count 2 would be consecutive to jail time in count 1. Court takes short recess. Re-called with same appearances, 11:28 AM. Schultz makes final statement, argues for impose 1 year straight time in ct. 1 concurrent with jail time in count 2, asks for length of probation 3-4 years. Elizabeth Bula (mother) makes statement. David Bula (father) makes statement. Bula makes statement, remorseful. Court has considered all statements of parties, reviewed reports in file, accepts representation of defendant, will accept the representation of protecting the community and not imposing the defendant to a prision sentence &  sentences the defendant to the following: Count 1 - 1 year in FC jail, huber allowed (can include treatment sessions as well), community service uner 973.03, credit for one day (stipulated), good time allowed, $500 surcharge plus costs paid through probation on count 2. Counts 2 & 3 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 7 years; consecutive to jail time in count 1. Count 2 - 1 year conditional jail time (huber allowed) consecutive to jail time in ct. 1. Conditions of probation: costs on each count plus $500 surcharge on each count, continue and follow though with current treatment, continue to be employed, computer/internet use for business use only, agree to random searches of electronics if deemed necessary by DOC, perform 250 hours of community service to be completed within first 2 years of probation, must report to FC jail on or before 12/4/15 at 4:30 PM. Voting and firearm restrictions given. Comply with sex registration under 973.048.

Defendant Justin Bula in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:04 AM. State - resolved but State needs time to file appropriate paperwork (Amended Information). Court will allow the amendment on the record. Schultz - still needs a recording of the defendant's statement and would like to hear that prior to going to sentencing. State responds and updates Court on the issue. Court continues bond and sets for for PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Justin Bula in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:39 PM. State - here for continuation of a motion hearing filed by the defense. Schultz agrees, has a witness and video to present. Schultz calls Erik McClintock. McClintock sworn in at 1:53 PM. Direct exam by State. Schultz offers exhibit #1 - DVD. Court allows Schultz to play video. Schultz continues to question witness, 2:05 PM. Simono re-directs, 2:08 PM. Witness excused, 2:11 PM. Schultz moves to accept exhibit #1. Court recieves exhibit #1. Schultz makes final argument on brief and ask court to order supression. State makes final argument and asks that the motion be denied, there was no violation in search warrant. Schultz responds. Court - will issue decision today versus a written decision and denies motion - does not find illegal entry into property for search warrant. Schultz indicates they would like a FPT. Discussion on discovery. Bond continued. If not settled by FPT date, both parties to expect quick trial date.
in Support of Amended Motion to Suppress: Search Warrant Particularity Obtained Through Curtilage/Trespass Violation
All exhibits are photos of property/house/driveway/ect.  #2 - was withdrawn

Defendant Justin Bula in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:36 AM. State - here for motion filed by defendant regarding defective search warrant. Court acknowledges that the State has filed a brief this morning and Schultz has not had a chance to respond. Court puts off record conversations on the record. Schultz makes statement and offers exhibit #1 - picture of no trespassing sign. Court is going to give Schultz time to reply to state's brief that was filed today. Court gives Schultz 5 days to file a brief and re-set the matter for another motion hearing. State would like to have the officers in court testify. Schultz responds. State calls Investigator Thomas Robinson. Schultz asks for sequestration. Court so orders. Robinson sworn in 10:56 AM. Direct exam by State. Schultz stipulates to the witnesses credentials. Cross exam by Schultz at 11:02 AM. Schultz offers exhibit #2 - photo of driveway; offers exhibit #3 - photo of defendant's residence, offers exhibit #4 - photo of defendant's residence, offers exhibit #5 - photo of defendant's vehicle. State objects - overruled (11:07 AM). Schultz offers exhibit #6 - photo of defendant's residence; Schultz offers exhibit #7 - photo of driveway and sign. Schultz moves for the receipt of exhibits #1 thru #7. Schultz withdraws exhibit #2. Court receives exhibits #1, #3 thru #7 after no objections (11:11 AM). State has no objections to the timing of the photo of exhibit #2 thru the filing of affidavits. Re-direct by State at 11:12 AM. Re-cross by Schultz at 11:13 AM. Schultz offers exhibit #8 - description of defendant's property. Court has questions of witness. Schultz re-cross at 11:22 AM. Robinson excused at 11:23 AM. Court will give Schultz a chance to reply to brief. Schultz wants to offer as an exhibit regarding an email conversation between himself and Simono regarding the no trespassing sign. State has no objections - would like it done thru sworn affidavit. Court - submit an affidavit regarding the sign or will allow him to call witness on the matter. Schultz prefers to call witnesses. Court continues bond, sets for another motion hearing. Schultz would like to present live testimony in regards to the sign. Schultz brief due 8/23/15. Court to look for 3 -4 day JT date - JA to look for time.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's opposing defendants motion to suppress the search warrant
motion to suppress - search warrant particularity obtained through curtilage/trespass violation
State's Motion and Order for Adjournment

Defendant Justin Bula in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 10:46 a.m. State - here for FPT, but Schultz has filed a motion which is scheduled for July 22, 2015. Parties discuss discovery issues. Court will have JA set for a 3 day JT on next available date.

Called 9:40 am. Justin Bula in person and with counsel Hank Schultz. State by JBC. Schultz pretty much resolved, waiting on discovery from DCI. State indicates that they have been trying to get the remaining discovery from DCI. Court may entertain motion to dismiss if DCI does not provide discovery within 14 days. Schultz may file motion to exclude evidence. Schultz asks for deadline for remaining discovery. Court orders all discovery within 14 days from all parties otherwise will entertain other motions or enforcement rights.
From attorney asking to withdraw motion.
State's brief opposing defendant's motion for suppression of evidence as search warrant was not stale
email from Attorney Schultz asking for adjournment of FPT - granted

Defendant Justin Bula in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:06 p.m. Schultz would like to waive right to a preliminary hearing, form has been provided to the court. Court goes through questionaire and finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently given up his right to a preliminary hearing. Court - finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Continue with arraignment. State has filed information which mirrors complaint.  Schultz waives further reading of information, enter NG pleas to all counts and would like FPT to be scheduled in late April or May due to assessments that are being conducted. Court - bond will continue. Adj. Final pre-trial scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Not to use the internet to access any pornographic sights and no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18 years.
Preliminary hearing on February 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Called at 1:52 PM. Justin Bula appears in person and with counsel Henry Schultz. State appeares by Charles Simono. Schultz has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 2/19/15 at 2:00 PM. Schultz - bond - argues for $5000.00 cash for stated reasons. State - bond - no objection to a reduction to $10,000.00 cash bond for stated reasons. Schultz responds. Court - bond - reduces to $10,000.00 cash with same conditions, refund remaining to poster. State - prohibition of any online activity with any electronic device that can reach the internet. Schultz responds. Court - bond conditions - no access to internet except for business purposes provided a program is installed on the computer that registers the keystrokes and no contact with any child under the age of 18 years old. State and Schultz responds. Court - not to use the internet to access any pornographic sights and no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18 years.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Called at 9:135AM. Justin Bula appears in person and with counsel Henry Schultz appearing specially. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Bula and Schultz have complaint, asking for another initial appearance, waives reading of it. Court will set this matter for AIA on 1/7/15 at 2:00 PM. Schultz - bond - asking for reduction to $5,000.00 cash bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Schultz responds. Court - bond - continues bond at this point.
No contact with any child under the age of 18
